basics.name: Tat-Thien Pham
basics.label: Software Developer and Engineer
basics.summary: I am a computer scientist from Aachen in Germany. Most probably, I will obtain my master's degree at RWTH Aachen at the end of 2018. During the employment as an apprentice and student assistant, as well as during the engagement in student-run organizations, I was able to get experience in full-stack software development, and especially the development of web applications (back- and frontend). I see myself as a software developer and engineer. Currently, my GitHub profile contains a single project, consisting of dockerized backend and frontend templates for a quick setup of a web application package with Spring Boot and React.

work.company: Laboratory for Machine Tools and Production Engineering (WZL) of RWTH Aachen University
work.position: Mathematical and Technical Software Developer Apprentice, Student Assistant
work.summary: While working at WZL, I was involved in several industry and research projects in the area of production management. In the course of these projects, I developed multiple Java- and Javascript-based web applications and individual software solutions for the purpose of configuring and optimizing products and production networks. This included the implementation of software, which extracts, processes, analyzes and presents data.
highlights: Development of a web-based process modelling tool with an automated, optimized visualization of the process landscape in the course of my bachelor thesis d3.js
Development and maintenance of a web-based tool to capture production data for a company in gear and transmission technology ASP
Development of a product configuration tool for a customer brand manufacturer VBA
Optimization of the utilization of machines within a production chain with the help of a genetic algorithm Java

volunteer.position: Marketing Manager, Community Engager, Trainer, Organizing Committee President
volunteer.summary: I joined the local student-run organization AIESEC in Aachen during my master's. Starting as a member in the marketing department, I was responsible for all local marketing activities, ranging from the planning and execution of info events, lecture presentations and the cooperation with partner initiatives and institutions. After half a year, I joined the national information systems team (NIST) of AIESEC in Germany. As a community engager in the NIST, I was responsible for the first-level support for all our technical systems, as well as providing the community with educational material for being able to work with the systems. In April 2017, I participated in a volunteering project in Recife (Brazil) called 'Global Volunteer' organized by AIESEC, supported with a scholarship by Microsoft. For two months, I worked in the community library 'Biblioteca Comunitária Caranguejo Tabaiares' within a favela. My main engagement was to plan and execute activities for children at the age of five to twelve years, which helped them to develop an awareness for cultural diversity. Furthermore, I took part in a trainer seminar in August 2017, which enabled me to act as a trainer within the organization. Up to now, I was able to train several intercultural, functional and team building workshops and seminars. Another opportunity was the organization of a national conference for 300 participants in January 2018. In the position of the organizing committee president, I was leading a team of 10 team members, coordinating finances, logistics and fundraising.

In parallel to AIESEC, I also joined the student-run organization TEDxRWTHAachen during my master's. In the position of the head of the IT-team, I was responsible for the maintenance of our website, database, communication and collaboration tools and livestreaming. This included the development of internal supporting tools, handling the ticketing and capacity planning for webhosting and cloud. Up to now I was part of the organization of two TEDx conferences with 200 and 350 attendees.
highlights: Maintenance of website phpMySQLJavascript
Maintenance of collaboration and communication tools
Capacity planning for webhosting and cloud

courses: Processes and Methods of Software Tests
Applied Software Engineering within the life cycle of Automotive Electronics Java Monticore
Information Management for Public Mobility Systems
Serious Games in Medicine Java Javascript React C#Unity Scrum

education.institution: FH Aachen – Aachen University of Applied Sciences
